text: Artie Kane (born Aaron Cohen; April 14, 1929 â€“ June 21, 2022) was an American pianist, movie score composer, and conductor. In 1976, he was nominated for a Grammy Award. During his career, he conducted on over 60 movie scores for MGM, Disney, Universal, Fox, Warner Brothers, Sony, and Paramount. His career lasted from 1944 until 2004. Kane died on June 21, 2022 at his home in Whidbey Island, Washington at the age of 93.Artie Kane, Studio Pianist and Film-TV Composer, Dies at 93 ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2022 deaths Category:American composers Category:American conductors Category:American jazz pianists Category:American pop musicians Category:Writers from Columbus, Ohio Category:Musicians from Columbus, Ohio Category:Writers from Seattle Category:Musicians from Seattle Category:American keyboardists
title: Artie Kane
